body: Are there any solutions or alternatives for this already?
On Windows, this can be achieved by setting the window extended style with the flag WS_EX_NOACTIVATE. I donÂ´t know how to achieve this on Mac and Linux though.

issue.title: [feat] Add focusable parameter to tauri.conf.json to allow creating non focusable apps

repository.name: tauri
repository.description: Build smaller, faster, and more secure desktop and mobile applications with a web frontend.

issue.body:
### Describe the problem

For kiosks, second screen apps in touchable screens any interaction makes to lose the focus on your main task.



Examples

The perfect example are the pc cases as Hyte Y70 that you can control computer volume, screen brightness and another functionalities from your computer, touching the screen:

-  Working in a document you will be forced to take the mouse and click again
- Playing games close the fullscreen and you need to get back to the game.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Add the parameter to tauri.conf.json.

  "app": {
    "windows": [
      {
        "title": "touchable-screen-app",
        "width": 800,
        "height": 600,
        "decorations": false,
        "focusable": false
      }
    ]
  }

Also it would require to add the functionality to tao.

### Alternatives considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

issue.title: feat: add focusable property and Window::set_focusable

repository.name: tao
repository.description: The TAO of cross-platform windowing. A library in Rust built for Tauri.

issue.body:
Adds the option to create non focusable windows and change that state with Window::set_focusable.

The feature was requested in https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/issues/11130
